title: Physical Security
description: Protecting physical access to systems and facilities

questions.question: Do you limit physical access to areas with IT systems?
questions.context: Server rooms, network closets, and offices with FCI need access control.
questions.examples: Locked doors, key cards, restricted areas
questions.followUp: Where are your servers? Who has keys/access cards?
questions.discussion: Physical access controls protect organizational systems, equipment, and supporting infrastructure. This includes facilities and areas within facilities containing systems that process, store, or transmit CUI.
assessmentObjectives: Physical access is controlled to facilities
whatToExamine: Door locks and key card systems

questions.question: Do you escort and monitor visitors?
questions.context: Visitors shouldn't wander freely, especially near sensitive areas.
questions.examples: Sign-in process, visitor badges, escort requirements
questions.followUp: How do visitors check in? Are they supervised?
questions.discussion: Visitors include individuals who don't have routine access. This includes customers, vendors, service personnel, and even employees from other departments.
assessmentObjectives: Visitor badges are used and collected

questions.question: Do you keep logs of physical access?
questions.context: You need records of who entered secure areas and when.
questions.examples: Visitor log book, key card logs, sign-in sheets
questions.followUp: How long do you keep visitor logs? Are they reviewed?
questions.discussion: Physical access logs help with investigations and can identify patterns of suspicious behavior. These should be protected and retained appropriately.
assessmentObjectives: Logs include date, time, and individual
Logs are retained for appropriate period
redFlags: Can't tell who accessed secure areas

questions.question: Do you control physical access devices (keys, cards)?
questions.context: Track who has keys, collect them when employees leave.
questions.examples: Key inventory, badge management, collection process
questions.followUp: Who manages keys/badges? What happens when someone leaves?
questions.discussion: Physical access devices include keys, locks, combinations, and card readers. These need to be inventoried, controlled, and collected upon termination.
assessmentObjectives: Inventory of physical access devices exists
redFlags: Unknown number of keys in circulation
